recommendations.recommendation: A good anime to make you feel like child again. Brings you into the fantasy that is gunpla builder kit coming to life. Overall a good anime but there`s not too much story line to it. A very fresh and welcoming change to the Gundam series, an anime to bring kids into the less complicated side of Gundam.

This is a refreshing and different take on the Gundam franchise as a whole. Rather than rehashing the old idea of how war can tear us apart (and how love can find its way in the midst of it), we take the GunPla industry and create a proxy battle system out of it. This is not new, as Angelic Layer is another series using almost identical concept. If you`ve seen at least one Gundam series, there`s something that may lure you into Build Fighters. On the other hand, looking from an outsider perspective, this is nothing more than an anime series to promote Bandai`s Gundam model kits (and to inspire creating customs).

anime.description: In the near future, GunPla Battles, competitions that pit Gundam plastic models against each other, have become popular worldwide in the Second GunPla Boom. http://anidb.net/ch57667 [Iori Sei], a first-year middle-school student and the only son of a model shop owner, is talented at building GunPla, but inexperienced in the GunPla Battles. He encounters a mysterious boy named http://anidb.net/ch57668 [Reiji], who happens to be an accomplished Gundam Fighter. Together, they strive for the GunPla Battle world championships. Sei`s customized GunPla is the http://anidb.net/ch57680 [Build Strike Gundam]. Source: ANN Note: The first episode was pre-aired at a special event on 04.10.2013, regular TV broadcast started on 07.10.2013.

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: future
tag.description: Anime that fall under the future category are the ones that have a society that could have originated from ours. In most cases it should go hand to hand with sci-fi since we expect the future to consist of advanced technology, however, in the case where it`s explicitly stated in the story that the anime takes place "x years into the future", the state of technology doesn`t matter as long as it`s long into the future. The anime can be set in an alternative universe not tied with our own, as long as it has a futuristic feel to it. This category sports quite a lot of anime, mostly stemming from SciFi, but not necessarily only from there.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: mecha
tag.description: Mecha in Japanese basically means mechanical things; everything from an electric whisk or a car to a spaceship or a robot. Here however we limit it to the more exotic things usually referred to as mecha anime: robots, whether controlled by a human or not, and their ilk. See Androids, Piloted Robots, Power Suits, Robot Helpers, Transforming Robots for a more specific classification.

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: proxy battles
tag.description: In our terms, a proxy battle is a battle where humans use creatures/robots to do the fighting for them, either by commanding those creatures/robots or by simply evolving them/changing them into battle mode. Often the training aspect is also involved, or in some cases the proxies are nothing more than holographic representatives of some other variation of competition (like for example a card game). While many popular shounen anime fit under this category, it`s not limited to shounen anime.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: light-hearted
tag.description: Not being burdened by trouble, worry, or care; happy and carefree. Just a casual and feel-good watch.

tag.name: competition
tag.description: Some sort of confrontation occurs in this show. The protagonists "duke it out" via various competitions.

tag.name: tournament
tag.description: A competition involving a large number of participants. Such competitions may range from friendly, moderated sporting events to anything-goes, all-out fights to the death. All participants take part in the tournament in want or need of the final goal and possible prizes; which depending on genre, may range from a boastful record at school to great riches and/or the granting of a wish. Depending on the type of tournament, contestants will either act alone, be permitted a team, or construct a team of chance throughout the ongoing competition.

tag.name: poverty
tag.description: It refers to the condition of not having the means to afford basic human needs.

tag.name: following one`s dream
tag.description: No matter what the hardships may be, at least one of the protagonists in this anime is following her/his dream. Examples: To become a professional athlete, a musician, a painter or the ruler of this world!

tag.name: mundane made awesome
tag.description: Sometimes normal just doesn`t cut it. Eating: you put food in your mouth and chew. Playing sports: you throw a ball around. You need to make it awesome, no matter how mundane it is. Let`s throw in some gripping orchestral music, lighting changes, different camera angles, something! Don`t write like a man, write like an evil overlord! Exaggerate your expressions and gestures, speak with excessive intonation, and if all else fails, throw in some close-ups, slow motion, and ominous Latin chanting! With practice, even you can turn something like eating chips into an epic battle of light and dark, blinding the viewer with sheer awesomeness. [Source: TV Tropes]

tag.name: Engrish
tag.description: Engrish is actually a mispronunciation of English, as can be the result of someone, who does not have English as their primary language of origin (such as Japanese or Chinese). Occasionally characters in the original Japanese dialogue version of an anime will speak in English... however; this often still requires the assistance of subtitles, for while the words are meant to be said in English, the sentence structure and letter pronunciation may still be strongly related to the person’s primary language.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Sayla Mass
character.description: At the beginning of the Mobile Suit Gundam TV series, Sayla is a civilian of Side 7, who comes aboard the mobile suit carrier White Base along with other civilians include Amuro Ray, Fraw Bow, Hayato Kobayashi, Kai Shiden and Mirai Yashima. Sayla is a Newtype much like her brother Char Aznable. Originally a medical student on Side 7, Sayla is almost immediately recruited as a soldier, and set to the task of watching over the civilian refugees. With the near total lack of experienced personnel to defend White Base (most original regular officers were KIA in Zeon`s Side 7 attack), Bright Noa assigns Sayla to the multiple positions of communications officer, medical officer, navigator, and finally combat pilot. Soon after joining the ship, she repeatedly looks for her brother Casval, and takes every opportunity to learn information about him and make contact. When Bright picks up a suspicious briefcase (later revealed to be full of gold bars) intended for Sayla, he confronts her and she admits that her true identity as Artesia Som Deikun, sister to Casval Rem Deikun (better known as Char Aznable), and the only daughter of Zeon Zum Deikun, the founder of the Republic of Zeon.

character.name: Lalah Sune
character.description: This young woman is a test subject of the Flanagan Institute, a Zeon research organization created to investigate the gifted humans known as "newtypes." While the exploits of pilots like Char and Amuro have led to speculation that they may be newtypes, Lalah`s powers are obvious and undeniable, and accompanied by a profound spiritual awareness. However, despite her gentle nature, Lalah is fiercely loyal to the man who saved her life - Char Aznable, the scheming "Red Comet."

character.name: RX-78-2 Gundam
character.description: The Gundam is one of three prototype mobile suits secretly developed by the embattled Earth Federation. After suffering tremendous losses to Zeon`s mobile suits earlier in the war, the Federation set out to create its own, using the very latest advanced technology. The Gundam is the most successful of these prototypes, a close-combat mobile suit protected by tough Luna Titanium armour, and armed with both lethal beam sabers and a devastating beam rifle as powerful as a battleship cannon. It`s also equipped with an advanced computer which learns from its pilot, ultimately enabling it to operate the Gundam automatically. In the hands of accidental pilot Amuro Ray, this one prototype mobile suit proves to be the equal of any Zeon weapon.

character.name: Zaku II Custom
character.description: This high-performance version of the Zaku II is designed exclusively for squadron commanders and veteran pilots. Although it has more powerful thrusters and a greater propellant supply than the standard Zaku II, the only external difference is the communications antenna on its forehead. Lieutenant Commander Char Aznable - the famous "Red Comet" - pilots this commander`s version of the Zaku II, painted in his trademark colors.

character.name: Kikka Kitamoto
character.description: Katz Hawin, Letz Cofan, and Kikka Kitamoto are three of the younger refugees who escape from Side 7 aboard the White Base. Having lost their parents, they latch onto their caretaker Fraw Bow and the rest of the ship`s crew, and soon become the White Base`s beloved mascots. Often mischievous, and always noisy, they nonetheless prove to be just as vital to the ship`s survival as their older crewmates. Source: Official Site

character.name: Katz Hawin
character.description: Katz Hawin, Letz Cofan, and Kikka Kitamoto are three of the younger refugees who escape from Side 7 aboard the White Base. Having lost their parents, they latch onto their caretaker Fraw Bow and the rest of the ship`s crew, and soon become the White Base`s beloved mascots. Often mischievous, and always noisy, they nonetheless prove to be just as vital to the ship`s survival as their older crewmates. Source: Official Site

character.name: Yuuki Tatsuya
character.description: Tatsuya is a third year student at the middle school section of the Seifuu Private Academy and the student body president. He is the school idol who is also the president of the model club. He is a prodigy at producing Gundam plastic models and battling. He has such great ability that he even participated in the Gundam plastic model championship. His other name is The Crimson Comet. Source: ANN

character.name: Kousaka China
character.description: China is a first year student at the middle school section of the Seifuu Private Academy, class president, and member of the art club. Her home is the restaurant Kousaka. As she watches http://anidb.net/ch57667 [Sei] get interested in Gundam plastic model battles, she herself becomes intrigued with the sport. She has a wise and reserved personality. Her chest is also "reserved." Source: ANN

character.name: Iori Sei
character.description: Sei is a first year student at the middle school section of the Seifuu Private Academy. As he is the son of the Iori Model Shop, he has enjoyed Gundam plastic models since he was young. His knowledge of Gundam and making Gundam models are far beyond an adult`s. However, he is unfamilar when it comes to Gundam plastic model battles, and always gets eliminated in the first round of the championship. Source: ANN

character.name: Aria von Reiji Asuna
character.description: Reiji is a mysterious boy that http://anidb.net/ch57667 [Sei] met in town. Reiji is pushy, selfish, is quick to resort to violence, and doesn`t know much about common sense in society. Although he was pulled into Gundam plastic model battles for the first time, he shows excellent talent in piloting. Source: ANN

character.name: MS-06R-AB Zaku Amazing
character.description: A Gunpla built by Seiho Academy student government president Yuuki Tatsuya, also known as the Crimson Comet. Tatsuya`s building and piloting skills combine to create an unbeatable foe. Based on the MSV High Mobility Model Zaku II, it`s also been unarmored and equipped with fixed weaponry. Its mix between ranged and melee power make it a potent contender on any battleground. Source: Official Website

character.name: GAT-X105B/FP Build Strike Gundam
character.description: A Gunpla created by Sei Iori, based on MOBILE SUIT GUNDAM SEED`s Strike Gundam. Focusing on mobility, it specializes in quick, hit-and-run attacks. While it`s put together extremely well, its weapons loadout is still incomplete, meaning there`s plenty of room to grow. Source: Official Website

character.name: GX-9999 Gundam X Maou
character.description: A version of AFTER WAR GUNDAM X`s Gundam X equipped with reflex thrusters. Its main weapon is its enhanced Hyper Satellite Cannon, which boasts devastating power worthy of the name Maou. Source: Official Website

character.name: XXXG-01Wf Wing Gundam Fenice
character.description: A unique, asymmetrical heavy modification of NEW MOBILE REPORT GUNDAM WING`s Wing Gundam. The modifications include the removal of Bird Mode. The antenna and winglike ear on the right side of its head both bear scars of battle damage. Source: Official Website

character.name: Yasaka Mao
character.description: Mao is a Gundam plastic model builder from Kyoto. He has been taught how to create Gundam plastic models since he was young. He appears to be spacey due to his appearance and Kansai dialect, but he in fact has a hot fighting spirit in his heart. He is a good rival of http://anidb.net/ch57667 [Sei]`s. Source: ANN

character.name: Iori Rinko
character.description: Rinko is http://anidb.net/ch57667 [Sei]`s mother and the owner of the Iori Model Shop. Even though she is the owner, she is not very knowledgeable about plastic models, and relies on her son for advice about them. Her specialty is cooking, and her best dish is stir-fried vegetables. Source: ANN

character.name: Ricardo Fellini
character.description: Ricardo Fellini is a regular competitor at the Gundam plastic model championship, and the representative for Italy. His other name is Italy`s Dandy Man. After arriving in Japan after traveling around the entire world, he has a fateful meeting with http://anidb.net/ch57668 [Reiji]. His hobby is searching for girls to hit on using Gundam plastic models, and he boasts that it has an 80% rate of success. Source: ANN

character.name: Iori Takeshi
character.description: Sei`s father, a famous Gundam fighter and runner-up in the second Gunpla Battle World Championships. He voyages the world, sending advances in Gunpla back home to his wife and son at the Iori model shop. Source: Official Website

character.name: Sazaki Susumu
character.description: A Gunpla Fighter who lives in Sei`s neighborhood. He`s constantly hatching plans to get a hold of Sei`s high-powered Gunpla for his own Battling use. His overbearing personality means he doesn`t have many friends. Source: Official Website

character.name: Gonda Monta
character.description: A 10th-grader at Seiho Academy, and a member of the student government`s executive council. He`s also a member of the modeling club, and holds great respect for its president Yuuki Tatsuya. He`s easily hurt by his nickname of Gorilla. Source: Official Website

character.name: Kirara
character.description: An Akiba-type Gunpla idol who sings, dances, builds, and even joins in Battles. She`s not very well-known yet, but she works hard, hoping that her Gunpla Battles will bring her popularity. Source: Official Website

character.name: RX-178B Build Gundam Mk-II
character.description: A Gunpla based on MOBILE SUIT Z GUNDAM`s Gundam Mk-Ⅱwhich begins to show more and more unique quirks as the anime continues. It features both a direct linkage between backpack generator and beam rifle for increased firepower, and a detailed history with a design lineage. Source: Official Website

character.name: Ral-san
character.description: A regular customer of the model store owned by Sei`s family. Aside from the fact that he adores the mobile suit Gouf, everything else about him is unknown, including his full name, birthplace, family status, and occupation. For some reason, many of the characters address him as Lieutenant. Source: Official Website

character.name: KUMA-03 Beargguy III
character.description: The first original Gunpla made by Kousaka China. Based on the Beargguy from GUNPLA BUILDERS BEGINNING G, it was completed with her own original concept of a cute stuffed animal turned into a robot. Although this is China`s first attempt at model-building, because she is also a member of the art club, the painting is extremely well done. Source: Official Website

character.name: Sengoku Astray Gundam
character.description: A unique customized version of the Astray Red Frame from MOBILE SUIT GUNDAM SEED ASTRAY. It was created by Nils Nielsen, an expert in Japanese martial arts, who uses these skills when controlling this Gunpla. Its main weapons are samurai swords called Kikuichimonji and Kotetsu, which can even cut through beams. Source: Official Website

character.name: Aila Jyrkiainen
character.description: The top fighter of the Gunpla team Nemesis, which is based in Finland. She has no experience with Gunpla creation and knows nothing at all about Gundam, but she has enough control technique to make up for it. Source: Official Website

character.name: Allan Adams
character.description: A young engineer who belongs to the PPSE Gunpla Works division of PPSE, the company that has monopoly control of the Plavsky particle generation system. As a Gunpla builder, his abilities are also at the world`s highest level. Source: Official Website

character.name: NMX-004 Qubeley Papillon
character.description: A customized version of a machine from MOBILE SUIT Z GUNDAM. It belongs to the Nemesis team, and is used by Aila Jyrkiäinen of Finland. Its main weapon is the lance bit. Like the base machine, it is equipped with many remote-controlled weapons, and even when fighting multiple enemies at once, it is powerful enough to overwhelm them. Source: Official Website

character.name: Misaki
character.description: The landlady`s daughter at an inn that Sei and Reiji visit on vacation. She is cheerful and energetic, but something seems to be troubling her. Source: Official Website

character.name: Nine Barthes
character.description: As Aila Jyrkiäinen`s manager, he also provides support and serves as her chief physician, but doesn`t personally participate in Gunpla Battle. Aila addresses him as Doctor. Source: Official Website

character.name: Chin`an Shishou
character.description: Yasaka Mao`s master is the founder of the Gunpla Shingyo school of modeling arts. He appears to be extremely fond of Murrue Ramius. Source: Official Website

character.name: Meijin Kawaguchi
character.description: A Gunpla builder who became famous when Gundam plastic models were first released. His works were praised as being made by the hand of God, and he was singled out as a Meijin. The Meijin`s title was handed down through the generations, and Yuuki Tatsuya is now the third to inherit the Kawaguchi name. Source: Official Website

character.name: Carlos Kaiser
character.description: The winner of the previous Gunpla Battle Championship World Tournament. Bearing the title King of Kaisers, he aims to win this tournament as well. Source: Official Website

character.name: Team (Nemesis) Kaichou
character.description: The owner of the private Gunpla team Nemesis, which is based in Finland. Using his abundant financial power, he intends to dominate the World Tournament. Source: Official Website

character.name: Greco Logan
character.description: A World Tournament contestant in the previous Gunpla Battle Championship, and a good rival to Fellini. Though he is known as the Raging Bull, his fighting style is subtle and accurate. Source: Official Website

character.name: Nils Nielsen
character.description: A scientific prodigy known as the Early Genius. Though this is his first time in the Gunpla Battle Championship, he is aiming for the World Tournament with the Sengoku Astray Gundam he created using his amazing intellect. Source: Official Website

character.name: Gawain Oakley
character.description: A fighter who belongs to the Gunpla team Nemesis, which is based in Finland. With the arrival of Aila Jyrkiäinen, his position has become extremely vulnerable. Source: Official Website

character.name: Luang Dallara
character.description: A Gunpla fighter who represents Thailand in the world tournament. Although he`s not the type to show his emotions outwardly, he is a passionate man whose heart burns with fierce fighting spirit. Source: Official Website

character.name: Yajima Caroline
character.description: The daughter of the president of the Yajima Corporation, a major trading company. A regular prize-winner at art exhibitions, she sees China as her rival. She has a bossy and willful personality. Source: Official Website

character.name: GAT-X105B/ST Star Build Strike Gundam
character.description: A new Gunpla built by Sei as he battles his way toward the World Tournament. It is greatly advanced from the original Build Strike, and the world`s Gunpla experts are amazed as it displays its hidden abilities. Source: Official Website

character.name: PPMS-18E Kampfer Amazing
character.description: A customized version of a mobile suit from MOBILE SUIT GUNDAM 0080: WAR IN THE POCKET. This is a works model created through the full efforts of the researchers at PPSE, which runs Gunpla Battle. Its back and legs can be equipped with container binders that hold all kinds of weapons. Source: Official Website

character.name: RGM-79K9 GM Sniper K9
character.description: A customized Gunpla based on the GM Sniper II from MOBILE SUIT GUNDAM 0080: WAR IN THE POCKET. As well as additional armor, it has a new foldable sniper rifle for increased firepower. It has many other hidden features, too. Source: Official Website

character.name: ZM-D11GRB Abigorbine
character.description: The Gunpla used by Thai champion Luang Dallara, a veteran of the Gunpla Battle Championship World Tournament. A modified version of the transformable mobile suit Abigor from Mobile Suit V Gundam, it can transform in the same manner as the original machine. It is about twice the size of other Gunpla in the same scale, and very powerful. Source: Official Website

character.name: Baker
character.description: A PPSE employee who serves as Chairman Mashita`s secretary. Attractive and intelligent, this talented woman helps keep the company running. Source: Official Website

character.name: Mashita Kaichou
character.description: The chairman and CEO (Chief Executive Officer) of PPSE, which rapidly became a global enterprise thanks to its exclusive control of Plavsky particles and the Gunpla Battle system. Source: Official Website

character.name: Rainer Cziommer
character.description: A Gunpla fighter who represents Germany. He resents Fellini for humiliating him in the past, and is waiting for an opportunity for revenge. Source: Official Website

character.name: MSN-02MR Hell Zeong Marine
character.description: A Gunpla specialized for underwater combat, based on the Zeong from MOBILE SUIT GUNDAM. It is used by the underworld operative known as C. Attached to its lower body are four heat rods and three claw arms with mega particle cannons, which it uses to entangle enemies and drag them into underwater battle. Source: Official Website

character.name: BuCUE Tank
character.description: A customized Gunpla used by the Renato brothers, based on the BuCUE from MOBILE SUIT GUNDAM SEED, which appears in the Gunpla Race during the seventh period of the World Tournament. Its crawler tracks give it good mobility even on bad roads, and it is also fully armed with missiles and combination beam guns/beam sabers attached to multi-jointed arms. Source: Official Website

character.name: C
character.description: An underworld operative who will carry out any Gunpla-related job, whether legal or illegal. Source: Official Website

episode.title: セイとレイジ
Sei and Reiji
Sei to Reiji
episode.summary: Even though Reiji has never used Gunpla before, he overwhelms Sazaki’s Gunpla with his superb control technique. Sei builds, and Reiji battles. Thus the Gundam Build Fighters are born! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 紅の彗星
The Crimson Comet
Kurenai no Suisei
episode.summary: Using Sei’s Build Strike Gundam, Reiji wins a total victory in his battle with Gonda. Then a crimson Gunpla appears before them both—the Zaku Amazing! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 最強ビルダー
The Strongest Builder
Saikyou Builder
episode.summary: Having won the Japanese 5th Block, he has already earned a place in the World Tournament, and he says he has come to the store because he is interested in Sei, a highly skilled builder who is the same age as he is. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ガンプラアイドル キララ☆
Gunpla Idol Kirara
Gunpla Idol Kirara
episode.summary: Mihoshi makes a deep impression on Sei, and as he advances through the championship, she repeatedly comes to see him at school as well as at the store. And Yuuki, who is with her, feels an indescribable anxiety when he sees Mihoshi. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: フルパッケージ
Full Package
Full Package
episode.summary: Sei and Reiji have now witnessed the overwhelmingly superior power of Tatsuya Yuuki’s Zaku Amazing. And on the day of the championship, Sei has somehow completed the Build Strike, but Reiji is nowhere to be found… Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 戦う理由[わけ]
A Reason to Battle
Tatakau Wake
episode.summary: But now that Yuuki has suddenly withdrawn from the competition, Reiji has lost his purpose, and aimlessly wanders the streets. Sei, too, is frustrated that he can’t have a rematch with Yuuki. Seeing the two of them, China feels an indescribable uneasiness. Now that Reiji is unable to fight Yuuki, where is he going to end up? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 世界の実力
World-Level Ability
Sekai no Jitsuryoku
episode.summary: Sei and Reiji have now earned their place in the World Tournament. Together with Rinko and China, they go to the summer sea, where they can all forget the usual battles and enjoy the seaside. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 逢戦士たち
Encounters of Fighters
Ai Senshi-tachi
episode.summary: Sei, Reiji, and Mao have been chosen to participate in the Gunpla Battle Championship World Tournament. Meanwhile, outside Japan, a series of qualifying tournaments have been underway in other countries to select players for the World Tournament. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 想像の翼
Wings of Imagination
Souzou no Tsubasa
episode.summary: Sei is working on a new Gunpla for use in the World Tournament. But, anxious about whether it’s safe to keep it “as is,” he has fallen into a kind of slump. When China unexpectedly ends up in a Gunpla Battle tournament limited to female players, she distracts Sei from his worries by asking him for Gunpla Battle advice. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 開幕!世界大会
The World Tournament Begins
Kaimaku! Sekai Taikai
episode.summary: The Gunpla Battle Championship World Tournament begins. One by one, representatives from throughout the world enter the holy ground of Shizuoka. The day before the tournament begins, Reiji skips the reception party and heads into town in search of tasty food, and there he has a fateful encounter with a mysterious girl. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ロワイヤル
Battle Royal
Royal
episode.summary: During the final battle of the World Tournament’s first day, a PPSE works team entered the tournament, thanks to the sponsor’s special rules. The name of its fighter is Meijin Kawaguchi, and Sei and Reiji are certain that another friendly rival has appeared. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ディスチャージ
Discharge
Discharge
episode.summary: During the second period of the World Tournament, all the players must compete in a Battle Royal elimination match. In the middle of the fighting, the battle is interrupted by the sudden appearance of a giant Mega Size Gunpla which belongs to none of the participating players. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: バトルウェポン
Battle Weapon
Battle Weapon
episode.summary: The World Tournament enters its third period, which consists of one-on-one battles using only the original weapons prepared by the tournament organizers. Nobody will know what the weapons are until the battle begins Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 暗号名[コードネーム]C
Codename: C
Codename C
episode.summary: The tournament has reached its sixth period, and only two periods now remain. Sei and Reiji have earned a good point score, and are working their way into the top group. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 戦士[ファイター]のかがやき
Fighter`s Radiance
Fighter no Kagayaki
episode.summary: Sei and Reiji have no choice but to win their next battle. But their opponent in the final period turns out to be the Italian champion Ricardo Fellini, who has been undefeated up through the seventh period. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 再会, 父よ?
Dad, We Meet Again
Saikai, Chichi yo?
episode.summary: This is a moment of relaxation, but Sei is focused on improving the Star Build Strike. When Sei refuses to let him help with the work, Reiji heads into town to prove that he too can build Gunpla. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 心の形
Model of the Heart
Kokoro no Katachi
episode.summary: As the World Tournament finals begin, Sei and Reiji find that their opponent in the first round is Mao Yasaka. When they met in Tokyo, they swore to fight in the World Tournament, and now that promise will finally be fulfilled. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ブラッド・ハウンド
Bloodhounds
Bloodhounds
episode.summary: The Renato brothers say they are fighting a war, not playing Gunpla Battle. Can the Meijin’s love of Gunpla prevail against enemies who only want to destroy their opponent? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: アストレイの刃
Astray`s Blade
Astray no Yaiba
episode.summary: Hearing this from Nils, the normally mild Sei is enraged. Nils’s Gunpla may be superb, but Sei finds it absolutely unacceptable for him to make a mockery of Gunpla Battle. With neither side willing to concede their desires, they begin their battle, and the hidden mysteries of Nils’s Sengoku Astray are finally revealed! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 裏切りのアイラ
Aila`s Betrayal
Uragiri no Aila
episode.summary: “I can’t be defeated! They’re waiting for me!” As the battle continues, Sei and Reiji arrive late to the arena thanks to an errand requested by Nils. When they get there, they witness an unexpected scene! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: きらめく粒子の中で
Amid the Glittering Particles
Kirameku Ryuushi no Naka de
episode.summary: As they continue a battle worthy of being called a death match, only Sei has misgivings. He isn’t trying to win, he’s wishing for a miracle! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 名人VS名人
Meijin vs. Meijin
Meijin vs. Meijin
episode.summary: Julian had withdrawn from Gunpla Battle, but after three years, he has now reactivated his Gundam F91 Imagine. Against him, Kawaguchi deploys the product of PPSE’s full effort, the Amazing Exia. With their wills and beliefs on the line, sparks fly between the two Meijins! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ガンプラ・イブ
Gunpla Eve
Gunpla Eve
episode.summary: Mao and Aila are hard at work building new Gunpla, and Fellini presents his own new model. “Let’s make this a great battle,” he says. With their promise to Yuuki in mind, Sei and Reiji face the tournament finals! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ダークマター
Dark Matter
Dark Matter
episode.summary: The Gunpla Battle Championship World Tournament finals have begun at last, but the arena is shrouded in a solemn atmosphere. The Gundam Amazing Exia, the Gunpla that Meijin Kawaguchi is using against Sei’s and Reiji’s Star Build Strike, has been painted black. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 約束
Promise
Yakusoku
episode.summary: After many ups and downs, the finals of the Gunpla Battle Championship World Tournament are over at last. However, in its aftermath, the Plavsky particle crystals have gone out of control. Source: crunchyroll
